text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: Only a few days remain until tryouts.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Th-th-th-this is a disaster! I'm ruined!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Classes are done for the day. A<n>flustered
Matikanefukukitaru bursts<n>into the trainers' room.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Waaah! What do I dooooo?!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Sniff... So I was doing a divinationearlier to see how tryouts would turnout...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: And it said that I would experience a<n>great misfortune!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
The harbinger of death is upon me! I<n>must rid myself of this
evil!

text_block_list.name: Taiki Shuttle
text_block_list.text: Extra! Extra! Breaking news—hot off<n>the press!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Wh-what are you talking about, Taiki?<n>I've got a bad feeling
about this...

text_block_list.name: Taiki Shuttle
text_block_list.text: They announced the groups for thetryouts! Fukukitaru, you won'tbelieve who you're goingagainst! It's gonna blow your mind!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Taiki Shuttle begins to recite the list of<n>runners, and
Matikanefukukitaru's<n>face grows more pale with every<n>
additional name.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
All the runners in her group are<n>extremely skilled—certainly
good<n>enough to make their debuts.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Arghhh! I'm done for! The race<n>hasn't even begun, and it's
already<n>over!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
This is what the divination meant by<n>misfortune—I'm sure of
it! Why did I<n>even bother?!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
With a look of defeat,<n>Matikanefukukitaru's shoulders<n>
slump, and she very gloomily goes<n>about her training.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Nnnnrgh! Fiiinally done!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Pant... pant... You don't need totell me my time. I already know Ididn't do well today.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Yeah, sounds good to me.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Sigh... It's impossible to breakfree from the shackles of destiny,huh?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
But I already knew that. I just didn't<n>want to accept it—that
I'm not good<n>enough to run in the Twinkle Series.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I actually have an older sister. She's<n>good at everything—the
perfect model<n>child. So people would often compare<n>the
two of us.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Don't get me wrong, it's not like I<n>hate my sister! If
anything, I really<n>respect her!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
It's just really hard not to compare<n>myself with her at
times...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: I mean, I wasn't even sure ofwhether or not I should—or well,could—attend Tracen Academy.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
But in the midst of my angst, the great<n>Shiraoki appeared by
my side and told<n>me...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: "Run! Run, and the path before you<n>shall open!"

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I took her words to heart and ran as<n>fast and as hard as I
could. Her<n>guidance is why I'm even here at all!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Listening to Matikanefukukitaru pour<n>her heart out, I'm
reminded of our<n>conversation the other day.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
If I'm ever feeling lost, down, or<n>anxious, she cheers me
up—makes<n>me feel better! She even helped me<n>during my
scrimmage with Taiki!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
The reason why I'm even here right<n>now is all thanks to the
great Shiraoki!<n>I chose to believe in her, and that<n>brought
me to where I am today...

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I'm unsure what Matikanefukukitaru<n>means when she
talks about this<n>Shiraoki being, but whatever her<n>reasons,
the divinations seem to be<n>motivating her.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
The divinations and fortune-telling are<n>dear to her, and they
have indeed<n>helped her get this far. That much I<n>can tell.
Perhaps I can put this<n>information to use...
choice_data_list: Actually, why don't we keep training?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Huh? But my luck has already hit<n>rock bottom! You
wouldn't find a gal<n>as jinxed as me even if you tried!<n>
Running in this state would be<n>completely pointless!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Matikanefukukitaru is reluctant to<n>resume her training, but I
eventually<n>sway her, and we commence round<n>two of our
training.

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Huff... Huff... I can't do this...anymore... My body... won't move...

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
The divination was right... Today's<n>training is nothing but
misfortune after<n>misfortune...
choice_data_list:
Just how much do you believe in these
divinations of yours?

Just how much do you believe in these
divinations of yours?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
Huh? What are you talking about? I<n>completely and utterly
believe in them,<n>of course!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
All the fortune-telling I've ever done<n>has led me to where I
am today! It's<n>basically my entire life!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
So it's not a question of whether or<n>not I believe in them.
They're<n>true—they have to be.
choice_data_list:
If that's the case, then you and I were also
destined to meet, right?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Of course! You're the trainer who will<n>change my fate!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
That's why I need to prove myself at<n>the next tryouts—to
show you the<n>results of all my hard training!
choice_data_list: Enough about the results, then! Just run!
Enough about the results, then! Just run!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Just... run?

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Ohhh, I think I get it! You're right! I<n>was being such a fool!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I have to quit dwelling on the<n>outcomes and focus on
running!<n>Fortune or misfortune, I need to run<n>my best
during tryouts!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
I'll do whatever it takes to get<n>scouted by you! That's my
goal!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text: Screw you, misfortune! I'm going tocharge ahead and show you what I'mreally capable of!

text_block_list.name: Matikanefukukitaru
text_block_list.text:
All right, I think I'm ready for another<n>round of running!
Come at me, world!<n>I'll rise to whatever challenge you<n>
have in store with everything I've<n>got!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
With a renewed look of pure resolve,<n>the now energized<n>
Matikanefukukitaru once again<n>dashes off into the distance.
